FEMA Reauthorization Act of 2012

Integrated Public Alert and Warning System Modernization Act of 2012
To reauthorize the programs and activities of the Federal Emergency Management Agency.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on 112-674, Part I.

Referred sequentially to the House Committee on Homeland Security for a period ending not later than Sept. 17, 2012 for a period ending not later than September 17, 2012, for consideration of such provisions of the bill and amendment as fall within the jurisdiction of that committee pursuant to clause 1(j) of rule X.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 486.

action.text: Mr. Denham moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2903.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

term.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.summary: 9/13/2011--Introduced. FEMA Reauthorization Act of 2011 - Authorizes appropriations for FY2012-FY2013 for: (1) the Urban Search and Rescue Response System, (2) Emergency Management Assistance Compact grants, and (3) the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) for management and administration.
